009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Vector version of the Nagao-Matsuyama filter.
021 * This class implements a 5x5 Nagao-Matsuyama filter, as described in [1].
022 * See Sec. 17.1 of [2] for additional details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] M. Nagao and T. Matsuyama. Edge preserving smoothing. Computer
026 * Graphics and Image Processing 9(4), 394â€“407 (1979).
027 * <br>
028 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
029 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
030 * </p>
031 */
032
033public class NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements NagaoMatsuyamaF {
034
035        // uses the same subregions as defined in {@link NagaoMatsuyamaFilterScalar}
036        
037        private final float varThreshold;
038        private float minVariance;
039        private final float[] rgb = new float[3];
040        private final float[] minMean = new float[3];
041        
042        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector() {
043                this(new Parameters());
044        }
045        
046        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector(Parameters params) {
047                this.varThreshold = (float) params.varThreshold;
048        }
049        
050        // ------------------------------------------------------
051        
052        @Override
053        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
054                minVariance = Float.MAX_VALUE;
055                evalSubregionColor(pack, Constants.R0, u, v);
056                minVariance = minVariance - 3 * varThreshold;
057                for (int[][] Rk : Constants.SubRegions) {
058                        evalSubregionColor(pack, Rk, u, v);
059                }
060                Matrix.copyD(minMean, rgb);
061                return rgb;
062        }
063        
064        void evalSubregionColor(PixelPack ia, int[][] R, int u, int v) {
065                final float[] S1 = new float[3];        // sum of pixel values
066                final float[] S2 = new float[3];        // sum of squared pixel values
067                int n = 0;
068                for (int[] p : R) {
069                        final float[] cp = ia.getPix(u + p[0], v + p[1]);
070                        
071                        S1[0] = S1[0] + cp[0];
072                        S1[1] = S1[1] + cp[1];
073                        S1[2] = S1[2] + cp[2];
074                        
075                        S2[0] = S2[0] + sqr(cp[0]);
076                        S2[1] = S2[1] + sqr(cp[1]);
077                        S2[2] = S2[2] + sqr(cp[2]);
078                        
079                        n = n + 1;              // pixel count in subregion
080                }
081                // calculate variance for this subregion:
082                float var0 = (S2[0] - sqr(S1[0]) / n) / n;      // variance red
083                float var1 = (S2[1] - sqr(S1[1]) / n) / n;      // variance green
084                float var2 = (S2[2] - sqr(S1[2]) / n) / n;      // variance blue
085                // total variance:
086                float totalVar = var0 + var1 + var2;    
087                if (totalVar < minVariance) {
088                        minVariance = totalVar;
089                        minMean[0] = S1[0] / n;
090                        minMean[1] = S1[1] / n;
091                        minMean[2] = S1[2] / n;
092                }
093        }
094
095}
